comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: makalin on November 08, 2022, 08:50:21 AMI'm searching for a simple blockchain structure - sample code, in any language, I'll be using as a referenceThanksI think that one of the simplest implementations may be Naivechain - a blockchain implementation in 200 lines of code, but I didn't read into the actual code.The related explanations are in this blog post.Some important missing points/limitations:Quote from: https://github.com/lhartikk/naivechain* Data is not persisted in nodes* No proof-of-work or proof-of-stake: a block can be added to the blockchain without competition

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: I found a Java code of a simple blockchain, isn't hard to find this kind of information, you only have to go to google and search what are you looking forÂ  I will leave here the link: https://www.baeldung.com/java-blockchainTo build your own blockchain you have to understand some concepts like Blocks, Nodes, Transactions and Mining.It's simple to have a blockchain without nodes, the complex part came when all the nodes have the same information, so, good luck with your project.
